Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned more about writing research papers and more about London history. I especially appreciated the insight on how different cultures influence a city and how those cultures and the city changes over time.
A deeper understanding of the history of Europe. I also learned how to write a research paper and give a ten-minute presentation.
The course seemed more like a survey course. I wish we could have gone more in-depth with the material, even at the cost of not covering so many topics.

The strength is that the readings are very interesting and the class is enjoyable. There are readings every class and 3 class presentations throughout the semester. The weakness is that the readings could be outlined and summarized a bit better by the student presenters.

I loved learning about London's cultural history through this course. Most of the learning, however, was through the readings. I would've loved for our professor to have shared more of her knowledge and expertise and even lecture us more as opposed to having student-run group discussions of the readings every class.
I highly recommend this course if you are interested in London history.
This was a fun, relatively low workload first-year seminar. I would highly recommend this course as a writing credit! Definitely shop it if you are interested in London/Europe!
